interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Beauty and the Beast (DVD, 2010, 2-Disc Set, Diamond Edition)
Review Date: 2014/10/17
Store: Paige O'Hara  (Actor),     Robby Benson  (Actor),     Gary Trousdale  (Director),     Kirk Wise  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Fully Loaded DVDs, DTS
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'This "tale as old as time" follows the adventures of Belle, a bright young woman who finds herself imprisoned in the castle of a mysterious beast. With the assistance of the castle\'s enchanted staff, a delightful and tender romance develops between these two unlikely friends and Belle soon learns the most important lesson of all — that true beauty comes from within.', 'Set Contains:', 'The most interesting of the extras on this multi-disc set is the storyboard for the first version of the film. British commercial animator Richard Purdum was originally slated to direct', 'Beauty and the Beast', ": he envisioned a darker retelling of the story with no songs. The storyboards and scratch voice track for this version offer rare insights into the creation of an animated feature--including the wrong turns. Although the artists boarded nearly a quarter of the film, the viewer sees very little of Beauty and nothing of the Beast; too much time is spent on Beauty's well-intentioned father, his comic horse, and her mean aunt. It's easy to see why Jeffrey Katzenberg rejected this version and called in Howard Ashman and Alan Menken. Unfortunately the discs have needlessly fussy, uncooperative menus: why list features on one disc that appear on another?", '--Charles Solomon']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Animation, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'AC-3, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, Dubbed, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Restored, Special Edition, Subtitled, WidescreenAC-3, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, Dubbed, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Restored, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen  See more', 'Contributor': "Paige O'Hara, Bradley Pierce, Hal Smith, Gary Trousdale, Mary Kay Bergman, Rex Everhart, Jesse Corti, Jo Anne Worley, Angela Lansbury, Jerry Orbach, Beauty & The Beast, Robby Benson, Richard White, David Ogden Stiers, Kirk WisePaige O'Hara, Bradley Pierce, Hal Smith, Gary Trousdale, Mary Kay Bergman, Rex Everhart, Jesse Corti, Jo Anne Worley, Angela Lansbury, Jerry Orbach, Beauty & The Beast, Robby Benson, Richard White, David Ogden Stiers, Kirk Wise  See more", 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (5.1 Disney Enhanced Home Theater Mix), Spanish', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 32 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '1.1 x 7.7 x 1.57 inches; 5.76 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'DV10227000', 'Director': 'Gary Trousdale, Kirk Wise', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, Dubbed, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Restored, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 32 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 23, 2010', 'Actors': "Paige O'Hara, Robby Benson, Richard White, Jerry Orbach, David Ogden Stiers", 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: My grandchildren love this movie.
Review Title: Five Stars
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

I bought this series for my granddaughter.  I grew up with Shirley Temple as a household world when I was a child and I wanted her to see this wonderful child actress.  She loves the movies as I do.

This dvd is such a joy at christmas time.  I used it at a christmas luncheon I was having and the guest really enjoyed all the beautiful music and the great christmas scenes and the color is great.
Sights and sounds of Christmas
Sights & Sounds of Christmas, The: the Complete Collection
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas
["Sure to become a part of your family's holiday tradition, the Sights & Sounds of Christmas rekindles your fondest memories... Santa Claus and his goodies, angel choirs, sparkling winters, glittering trees... 1,000 spectacular scenes come to life with 23 of the most popular songs and traditional carols ever recorded. This special DVD production promotes warm feelings of love and fellowship and will make the perfect accompaniment to any holiday gathering."]

Almost Home For The Holidays
n/a  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Music Videos & Concerts
["A Heartwarming DVD for anyone who loves a white Christmas. Almost Home for the Holidays creates the ambience of the holiday spirit for those who live in perpetual sunshine or just a reminder for all of just how beautiful winter can be. It is a beautifully filmed winter wonderland by award winning video photographers featuring peaceful traditional instrumental carols such as Jingle Bells, Silent Night and Joy to the WorldIt's winter as it should be.. Lot's of glorious snow...and not a shovel in sight."]

Christmas Snowfalll
I'll Be There
Charlotte Church  (Actor),     Craig Ferguson  (Actor, Director, Writer)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
['Product description', "A has-been 80's pop star finds renewed purpose when he learns he has a teenage daughter.", 'Genre:', 'Feature Film-Comedy', 'Rating:', 'PG13', 'Release Date:', '1-JUN-2004', 'Media Type:', 'DVD', 'Amazon.com', "This low-key, thoroughly delightful comedy is the product of Scottish comic/actor/writer/director Craig Ferguson's goofy and sweet imagination. Ferguson plays retired rock star Paul Kerr, a 1980s sensation whose whiskey-fueled antics in a Welsh mansion land him, involuntarily, in a psychiatric hospital. In short order, an old bandmate (Ralph Brown) turns up to help Paul get sober, and a long-lost love (Jemma Redgrave) introduces the mortified musician to an adolescent daughter (", 'Charlotte Church', ') he never knew he had. Lots of catching up and relationship repairs ensue, but the film is really an off-center, eccentric comedy in which quaint villagers debate the origins of guitar feedback and 75-year-old veteran actor Joss Ackland (', 'Surviving Picasso', ") can be found performing Roy Orbison rockers. A pleasant surprise is golden-throated Church's acting debut; revered for years as a singing prodigy, she proves to be a natural actress and outstanding pop-song stylist.", '--Tom Keogh']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Nostalgia for Classic Film**: The user cherishes classic films and enjoys timeless entertainment that evokes fond memories, particularly iconic stories and characters.

- **Family-Oriented**: Recent interactions highlight the user’s commitment to selecting films that create joyful experiences for family, especially grandchildren, illustrating a focus on shared entertainment.

- **Enjoyment of Animated Classics**: The user has shown a preference for animated films, particularly those with heartwarming narratives that resonate well with younger audiences.

- **Diverse Genres Appreciation**: Attracted to engaging films across various genres, the user places importance on options that appeal to multiple generations, ensuring inclusive viewing experiences.

- **High Ratings for Quality**: Consistently providing high ratings for fulfilling films indicates a discerning taste for quality entertainment that leaves a lasting impact.

- **Admiration for Talented Performers**: Continuously expressing appreciation for exceptional actors contributes to the user’s enjoyment of both serious and light-hearted cinema.

- **Accessibility and Inclusivity**: A preference for films with multiple language options and subtitles reflects a commitment to inclusivity, accommodating diverse audiences.

- **Preference for Heartfelt Content**: The user favors narratives that enrich family gatherings and create a warm, inviting atmosphere, celebrating shared experiences.

Overall, the user embodies a blend of nostalgia and family engagement through diverse, quality storytelling and performances, with a particular fondness for animated classics that appeal to all ages.
